entry.title: libstdc++: remove initialization of drag_state_ in InputHandler
entry.content:
Destructor of std::unique_ptr in libstdc++ uses sizeof() which

requires full definition of struct DragState. But the initialization

of drag_state_ with nullptr is not required, because std::unique_ptr

default value is nullptr already.

entry.title: Clamp KEY_MAX_INPUT_SIZE, retrieve actual value from input format.
entry.content:
We specify a input size value which is too small for tiny video

(62x62) frames. MediaCodec ignores this and sets its own preferred

value, so we should retrieve the actual value.



If we don't, we'll end up trying to reconfigure the codec when we

get an input larger than our estimatead size. This is extra

problematic if we transition from a software to hardware codec

with a higher minimum size during this event.



We'll also now clamp to 128x128 when calculating the minimum input

size, which turns out to be ~6k (MediaCodec then chooes a 2MB value).



R=liberato

entry.title: [Metadata][Metrics] Exclude both C1 virtual card images from metadata metrics logging
entry.content:
The server hasn't rolled out card metadata as of yet, but there are

considerable metrics for Capital One cards with metadata

(http://shortn/_aE0GXe1tII).



This is likely because we're logging Capital One's card art image for

virtual cards as metadata. We have had a CL (crrev.com/c/4420532) to fix

this, but it filters out the 2 URLs for these images conditionally on a

flag. Since this is a server controlled experiment, and server has no

visibility of Chrome flags, the right URLs are not being sent from the

server side as expected by the client.



Filter both the URLs as they're exclusively used for C1 virtual cards

and are not considered metadata as far as the card metadata project is

concerned.



Note: In the UMA, we still see metrics for other issuers like Amex

because of internal dev/testing.

entry.title: Apps Grid View tests clean-up p1
entry.content:
Prepare to migrate all drag test into using Loop Closure on testing to

enforce more production-like code unit tests.



This CL removes the method InitiateDragForView, which is only used on

some tests. Those tests now first use StartDragForViewAndFireTimer to

initiate drag and then let MaybeRunDragAndDropSequenceForAppList start

the drag sequence.



This CL also gets rid of current_drag_location_ class member, and now

queries the EventGenerator for the screen_location where the last event

took place.

entry.title: [dPWA] Add 'x' button back for reparented tabs.
entry.content:
This change set the 'initial' url stored in the AppBrowserController

to the start_url of an app if it was created via reparenting.

Reparenting only occurs on install. This fixes the case where the

install_url is not in scope of the installed app.

entry.title: exo: Create cursor bitmap from buffer when possible
entry.content:
When cursor surface buffer format is RGBA_8888 or BGRA_8888, we

can create a SkBitmap from the buffer directly. As of now, cursor

in lacros, arc and crostini all have buffer in the above formats.



If other clients use other formats, exo pointer would go through

the old approach by sending request to viz and capture the cursor

bitmap.

entry.title: WebUI: Simplify the names and class structure of cr_components/ tests.
entry.content:
Now that js2gtest is no longer used, there is no distinction between

"mojo" and "non-mojo" tests.

- Merging cr_components_mojo_browsertest.cc into

cr_components_browsertest.cc

- Simplifying test names, by not unnecessarily using a multiple C++

test classes.



Example renames for browser_tests:

- CrComponentsColorChangeListenerTest.All ->

CrComponentsTest.ColorChangeListener

- CrComponentsManagedFootnoteTest.All ->

CrComponentsTest.ManagedFootnote



Where the somewhat meaningless "*.All" naming pattern is now unnecessary. This also makes it a bit easier to



1) run all such tests, for example by passing

`--gtest_filter=CrComponentsTest.*` instead of

`--gtest_filter=CrComponents*Test.All` previously

2) distinguish browser_tests (CrComponentsTest.*) from

interactive_ui_tests (CrComponentsFocusTest.*)

entry.title: Make RasterBufferProvider self-flushing.
entry.content:
Forcing the caller to Flush() was brittle (crbug.com/1421227). Now

TileManager sometimes flushes unnecessarily (PrepareToDraw if no raster

work has occurred), and in a few places seems like it might still fail

to flush when it should.



By moving the flush logic into the RasterBufferProvider implementation

we can be more confident about correctness as well as more performant.

entry.title: Script: Use module response referrer policy for descendant fetches
entry.content:
This CL implements https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9210, which

allows for the `Referer-Policy` header delivered on module scripts to

be used in the request for their descendant scripts. This CL

accomplishes this by:

- Marking `ScriptFetchOptions::referrer_policy_` as mutable (to avoid

having to carry it around as a non-const everywhere it is currently

const). This might feel a little weird but there seems to be ample

precedent in `ModuleScriptCreationParams`

- Adding a new `response_referrer_policy` member to

`ModuleScriptCreationParams`

- Use `ModuleScriptCreationParams::response_referrer_policy_` to

influence `ScriptFetchOptions::referrer_policy_` in

`ModuleScriptLoader::NotifyFetchFinishedSuccess`, corresponding to

the spec PR changes in #fetch-a-single-module-script



There are four entry points into

`ModuleScriptLoader::NotifyFetchFinishedSuccess`:

1. DocumentModuleScriptFetcher::NotifyFinished

2. InstalledServiceWorkerModuleScriptFetcher::Fetch

3. ModuleScriptFetcher::Client::OnFetched

4. WorkerModuleScriptFetcher::NotifyClient



Each one of these (though, a bit further up the pipeline for (4)) is

modified to parse the `Referer-Policy` header from the resource and pass

it into the `ModuleScriptCreationparams`.



[1]:

https://whatpr.org/html/9210/9bf6568...fffb2ba/webappapis.html#fetch-a-single-module-script



Bug: 1462366

Change-Id: Ib7e21e0fb315ef3823fdcf98ec07dce1fb5261c9

Original change's description:

> Add enterprise policy for Web MIDI permissions

>

> All MIDI access is being gated behind a permission prompt. The

> permission exists in Chromium, but has been set to always allow.

> This is an enterprise policy to control the permission now that it

> will be configurable.

>

> I followed this:

> https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/enterprise/add_new_policy.md

>

> This CL has differences from the published steps:

>

> 1) The steps say to register the prefs, but it looks like this is

> done automatically in content_settings_policy_provider.cc

>

> 2) I couldn't figure out what was necessary to support dynamic_refresh

> 3) We have a Finch flag (BlockMidiByDefault, see

> https://crrev.com/c/4520509) but I didn't see how to use it to

> guard portions of this CL

entry.title: FLEDGE: Fix Stochastic rounding
entry.content:
A bug was introduced in a previous CL so that numbers less than half-way

to the next representable number were never rounded up. This meant that

the rounding was not preserving the average value. This CL fixes that

bug and also fixes the underlying bug that change was working around.



The underlying bug turned out to be that on certain systems (x86)

floating point operations are performed with 80bit arithmetic and

rounded to the nearest 64bit floathing point number. When this rounding

occurs *after* the random number is added but *before* we take the floor

this gives us the incorrect result. This CL changes the logic to avoid

relying on a specific rounding mode.



Change-Id: I3cfc72e51ffb828f2dcb87ac347fb33a0bd53a3f

entry.title: Partial damage for primary plane overlay (non-delgating)
entry.content:
Partial damage for Lacros non-delegated has not been working properly

likely since a buffer queue refactor. The issue here is that normally

partial damage applies to |frame->sub_buffer_rect| on 'SwapBuffers'[0]

and then into |output_surface_plane_->damage_rect| on the gpu-main [1]

thread. However with buffer queue the primary plane overlay is

directly assigned in 'FinishDrawingFrame' which runs before the

previous two calls.



[0]

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:components/viz/service/display/skia_renderer.cc;drc=ac872e771ce001fef191848bab4167d60dfda403;bpv=1;bpt=1;l=1001

entry.title: Correct NOTREACHED condition in a valid code path
entry.content:
This CL has the change to correct the condition for NOTREACHED from a valid code path.

Brief:

- The crash is mainly seen for extensions which registers

chrome_url_overrides in manifest and have not been enabled once.

- NOTREACHED is hit when uninstall for such extensions is triggered.



Issue:

- URLOverrides are registered when an extension is loaded (Enabled),

and they get unregistered as part of OnExtensionUninstalled event.

- In UpdateOverridesLists method, it's expected that all url overrides

being unregistered (the one read from manifest) are present in the

ExtensionWebUI::kExtensionURLOverrides pref list.

- But for extensions which registers chrome_url_overrides in manifest,

and are installed but not loaded (enabled), this condition won't hold

true. Example: All external extensions (loaded via registry), as

these do not get enabled by default, on install.



Bug: 1376708

Change-Id: I18c166897e05d26530daf903d8f4664637259e73

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4619850

entry.title: Remove the need for FooterView::CalculatePreferredSize
entry.content:
This is called very frequently and the logic has gotten more complex,

so it would be simpler to just update the visibility of the FooterView

when the footer data is set and then rely on the FlexLayout for

proper margins.



The logic could be slightly simpler if we call UpdateVisibility after

the calls to both SetAlertData and SetPerformanceData, but it would

be a riskier API since someone could make a future update that only

sets one of them or forgets to call UpdateVisibility. This seemed to

be a compromise on safety and efficiency.



Also added a type alias for the FooterView types to make that more

readable and hid the children view getters from FooterView.



Change-Id: I7a96233fe8aabccef1ef0fe3476f833583fcf2aa

entry.title: [VoiceIsolation] Add new stream effect VoiceIsolation.
entry.content:
New api introduced to provide the options to force turn on/off system

voice isolation(NC) effect and check the platform availability.



The control will be a tri-state composed of two bits(browser_controlled_{effect}, {effect}).

!browser_controlled_{effect}: leave as platform default.

browser_controlled_{effect} && {effect}: force enable platform {effect}

browser_controlled_{effect} && !{effect}: force disable platform {effect}



Design: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1a1zy_wYTgKhaPIAZ53lR8Y1RQzuzhND_kV7PLlP5WzE/edit?resourcekey=0-snrCqjLZrU8Bt9V0kW2hZA#heading=h.c0uts5ftkk58

BUG=b:218593870

TEST=build chrome, deploy to dut and verify

entry.title: Patch browser process to block multiple session requests
entry.content:
This strengthens/enforces the assumption that many Xr devices had been

operating under which is that they would not receive a RequestSession

call when they currently had an exclusive session our outstanding

session request. As the XrRuntimeManager is created by the first

VrServiceImpl and then kept alive by each subsequent VrServiceImpl it

(and therefore the connections to the devices via BrowserXrRuntime) is

effectively a singleton, and thus is situated to be able to

authoritatively answer whether there is a current outstanding

session request, and thus any new requests should be ignored.



Fixed: 1450707

Change-Id: I9806c1381f7c2d7419cc93adf7023cfa12d062fd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4658833

entry.title: cros_next: fix rounded scroll bar tests
entry.content:
Rounded scroll bar will apply MaterialNext features when

IsJellyrollEnabled returns true which means when the feature

kJelly or kJellyroll is enabled. However, in the unit tests we

only enable/disable the kJellyroll feature which makes the tests

fail when only Jelly is enabled.



This fixed the issue by enabling/disabling the Jelly and Jellyroll

at the same time.

entry.title: viz: Use exact match for render pass backing only for root
entry.content:
Since https://crrev.com/c/4559067 we only keep render pass backing

allocations if its size exactly match the requirements. This causes a

regression when render passes rapidly change size, e.g. with

animations. This CL mitigates the issue by only enforcing the "exact"

match metric for the root pass, which we don't expect to resize as

often.

entry.title: Record log closed time on main thread
entry.content:
MetricsLog::CloseLog() may be called on the background. For ongoing

logs, it will record the current time using some "clock". This "clock"

is leaky, and all it does is return Time::Now(). So there's no chance

of a UAF (use-after-free).



However, there is work under way to use a different clock, which is

*not* leaky (owned by BrowserProcessImpl). See crrev.com/c/3322058



So there is a chance that this new "clock" would be accessed on the

background thread after it has been released (e.g., the user shuts

down Chrome while the background task is running).



This CL records the "closed time" on the main thread, before the task

to finalize the log is posted on the background thread. Though, this

may mean that the "closed time" is slightly off (I would guess that

it would be only be by a few milliseconds under normal circumstances).





NOTE: as per the current behaviour, this CL will only record the

"closed" time for ongoing logs. I.e., it is not recorded for stability

and independent logs.

entry.title: Make FeedStream GC-able
entry.content:
FeedStream and its native counterpart were never deleted.

This change allows FeedStream to be GC'd, along with

the corresponding native parts.



Because some calls to FeedStreamJni can happen after

FeedStream.destroy() is called, this change is non trivial.

To make this work, I've made most JNI calls static, and

instead pass in a SurfaceId. The FeedStreamSurface is no

longer a public feed api, and is replace by SurfaceRenderer.

FeedStreamSurface still exists, but its lifetime is now

managed by components/feed rather than java. SurfaceRenderer

is the new public part, which be destroyed along with

FeedStream.destroy().



A couple good fallouts of this:

* FeedApi functions are more consistent, mostly replacing

SurfaceType with SurfaceId.

* There's now only one feed_stream.h, which avoids confusion

* FeedSurfaceRendererBridge takes responsibility for native calls

from FeedStream.java, which shrinks FeedStream a small amount.



Coverage justification:

FeedStream.java: no actual change in coverage, but moved lines and updated lines which have no effect trigger this

FeedSurfaceRendererBridge.java: new glue code, unit test is not helpful

feed_surface_renderer_bridge.cc: moved glue code, same coverage as before



Bug: b:288265395

Change-Id: Ibefa75dd0208156dea39ff646016e58194b7d4a7

Low-Coverage-Reason: a few reasons, see above

entry.title: [DIPS] Group and clean up 3PC settings checks.
entry.content:
Earlier we held off on checking for 3P cookie exceptions until the deletion step, so we could collect UKM metrics even for exempted sites. We decided we don't need these metrics anymore, so we can start checking for any cookie exceptions prior to recording a bounce.



This has the following side effects:

- The global BlockThirdPartyCookies setting is included in this check, so we now avoid recording a bounce when 3PC is enabled by default (unless the user has an override under Block Sites). NOTE that this will greatly reduce our metrics volume, some weird data effects are expected as this rolls out.

- Block Sites overrides are now accounted for, even when 3PC are default-allowed (crbug.com/1446350).

- Fine-grained exceptions (1P+3P pairs) are now accounted for (crbug.com/1458994).



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Removing DIPSCookieMode enums with 3PC blocking turned off - we now check for this before recording a bounce, so all data entries will have 3PC blocking on.



Change-Id: I480b410bb47ac634e975366de8069e66dc036102

entry.content:
All MIDI access is being gated behind a permission prompt. The

permission exists in Chromium, but has been set to always allow.

This is an enterprise policy to control the permission now that it

will be configurable.

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/enterprise/add_new_policy.md



This CL has differences from the published steps:

done automatically in content_settings_policy_provider.cc

https://crrev.com/c/4520509) but I didn't see how to use it to

guard portions of this CL

entry.title: [a11y] Delete BrowserAccessibilityComWin::owner_
entry.content:
The owner of a BrowserAccessibilityComWin instance (a kind of

AXPlatformNode) is an instance of BrowserAccessibilityWin (a kind of

AXPlatformNodeDelegate). Since a Node always has a pointer to its

Delegate, we can use that to get a BACW's owner rather than keep another

(identical) pointer from a BACW back to its corresponding BAC. This

shaves 8 bytes off of a BACW instance.

entry.title: Fix flaky FileMetricsProvider tests
entry.content:
In short, what the test does is post multiple tasks to a background

thread. For example, the first task creates 1 histogram, and the second

task creates 2 histograms.



The test was verifying this -- i.e., after the first task, we have 1

histogram, and after the second task, we have 2. But the problem was

that while checking the number of histograms after the first task,

it was possible that the second background task had started and

finished running, so the number of histograms we were seeing was

incorrect, causing flakiness.



This CL refactors the test to fix this issue.



Fixed: 1459709

This is a reland of commit 19fa2fbae6b7a11f77ea2399b714c13e71ba5f7b



The revert was cuz mac-official had rust disabled, but this

gtest target enabled, which breaks gn gen. But mac-official had

Rust enabled shortly after.



Original change's description:

> Reland "Add rust_gtest_interop_unittests on ~all bots that run base_unittests"

>

> This is a reland of commit 55cff755dae2b480964c463313a58cbd2358ec9c

>

> Sanitizer builds are fixed in https://crrev.com/4661400

>

> Bug: 1293979, gn:340, 1459686

>

> Original change's description:

> > Add rust_gtest_interop_unittests on ~all bots that run base_unittests

> >

> > Enable compilation of the test suite globally, and add it to the set

> > of tests that bots run.

> >

> > The test suite is 10 tests large, so it's very quick to build and run.

> >

> > iOS is excluded as framework_dirs breaks GN for generating Ninja

> > rules of Rust targets.

> >

> > Bug: 1293979, gn:340, 1459686

> > Change-Id: If3fff290b5e7597a93b94ba70f097e95235f2434

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4653253

> > Auto-Submit: danakj

> > Commit-Queue: danakj

> > Reviewed-by: Ben Pastene

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1164801}

entry.title: graphite: Remove unneeded dawn's features.
entry.content:
Removed the following:

- Unneeded features:

- DepthClipControl: This is only for disabling depth clipping.

We don't use it in graphite.

- Depth32FloatStencil8: No need because graphite will use

Depth24PlusStencil8 format.



Bug: 1456492

entry.title: Reland "[CR2023] Fix Textfield hover when selected."
entry.content:
Original CL was reverted because omnibox did not have an inkdrop.

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4651397



This lead to a crash where OnMousePressed is attempting to dereference a null pointer to inkdrop. Fix is to check if the textfield has an inkdrop before attempting to change hover state.

entry.title: Tab DnD: Inform SysUI to position the new Chrome Window.
entry.content:
A targeted broadcast intent with positioning data is posted for the SysUI to receive if it is listening to position the next Chrome Window being launched.



The call is behind the TAB_DRAG_DROP_ANDROID flag and gets ignored on all existing platforms SysUI.



Bug: 289443484

entry.title: WebUI: Introduce a couple c/t/data/webui source_set() targets.
entry.content:
Specifically introducing:

- chrome/test/data/webui:browser_tests

- chrome/test/data/webui:interactive_ui_tests



and offloading the equivalent targets in chrome/test/BUILD.gn, which has

become very large and hard to follow.



The new targets will hold all new WebUIMochaBrowserTest based tests, as

the move off of js2gtest makes progress.

entry.title: iwa: Create GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand
entry.content:
This command will iteratively find paths of all isolated Storage

Partititions from installed Chrome Apps and IWA, and add them to an

allowlist.

It'll then clean up any Storage Partition paths that are not:

- Actively loaded in StoragePartitionMap.

or

- Found in the allowlist.



Bug: 1453520
